result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David W. Barhyte

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Linehan.  State moved to amend Count 1 in 16CF27. Granted.  Information filed with the court.  Information in 16CF98 will be filed today.  Reading waived.  Defendant plead guilty to that charge.  Also, defendant plead guilty to count 1 in 16CF50, and Count 2 in 16CF98.  All other pending charges in criminal and traffic cases dismissed and read in for sentencing purposes.  CV cases remain open.  PSI will be requested. Court recited the charges and possible penalties on the counts he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Priors and repeater allegations confirmed by the court.   Felony warnings given to the defendant.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Felony Bail Jumping, contrary to 946.49(1)(b), as a repeater, Possession of Methamphamine, contrary to 961.41(3g)(g), and Possession with intent, Amphetamine, contrary to 961.41(1m)(e)2.  PSI ordered due by 2/17.  SEH set for 3/6 at 10 am.  Bond continued.  Track CV cases.
Plea hearing on January 9, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant appears with counsel Daniel Linehan.  DA Gerald Fox  appears for the State.  They have agreement on all the cases and can be set for plea date only prior to jury trial date.  Court sets for 1-09-17 at 10:00 for plea hearing.  No sentencing only plea.  Civil cases continue to track.

Jury trial - 12 person on February 9, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on January 23, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Information filed with the court.  Waive reading of the information.  Defendant entered NGP.  Court entered NGP.  Set for jury trial.  Set oldest felony first.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Linehan.  Court reviewed the waiver form with the defendant.   Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing.

Waiver of Prelim on July 28, 2016 at 09:15 am.
Arraignment on July 28, 2016 at 09:15 am.

Defendant appears in custody in person from Jackson County Jail with counsel Daniel Linehan.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Attorney Linehan states they will be working on a global resolution of all cases.  All pending cases are to track together.  Status set for 6-27-16 at 3:00.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on J.R.W. to appear on June 28, 2016 at the preliminary hearing
Preliminary hearing on June 28, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant appeared with counsel Daniel Linehan.  Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Attorney Linehan states he will schedule the preliminary hearing on 16CF42 for 30 minutes with the J.A.  Other cases will continue to track.
Status conference on June 9, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Pre-trial conference on April 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on May 2, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Court questioned defendant of his understanding of the waiver of time limits.  Defendant understood.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the time limits for holding the preliminary hearing.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Linehan appeared in court.  Waive reading of the  complaint.  Court advised the defendant of the charges and possible penalties.  PTC set for 4/13 and STC set for 5/2 at 3 pm.

This bond covers cases 16CF42 and 16CF27: Cash bond posted on 16CF27 February 27, 2016 covers this case also:   Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: G. L. and H. C..  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.
AIA adjourned to 3/21/16 at the telephone request of Atty Linehan who is now representing the defendant. ok'd with Michelle in DA's office.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 21, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County jail

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County jail.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint.  Court advised the defendant to contact SPD for representation on this case.  Bond set.  AIA set for 3/14/16 at 9 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.

This bond covers cases 16CF42 and 16CF27: Cash bond posted on 16CF27 February 27, 2016 covers this case also:   Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: G. L. and H. C..  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.
